basics.name: Iuliia Zaitova
basics.label: AI Researcher (PhD candidate)
basics.summary: AI researcher in computational linguistics (finishing PhD early 2026) focused on foundation models, multilingual NLP, and systematic evaluation; experienced with large-scale transformer training, PyTorch, and AWS.

education.institution: Universitaet des Saarlandes (Department of Language Science and Technology)
education.thesis: Modeling Mutual Spoken Word Intelligibility between Slavic languages

work.summary: Built and evaluated transformer-based speech and language models (10B+ parameters), multilingual evaluation pipelines, and AWS data flows for production voice assistants.

work.company: Spoken Language Systems (LSV), Universitaet des Saarlandes
work.summary: Experimental work on transformer representations, attention patterns, and cross-lingual capabilities; reproducible pipelines; publications at ACL/NAACL/Interspeech.

work.company: Information and Service Systems, Universitaet des Saarlandes
work.summary: Neural models for sales prediction using time-series data.

publications.title: It's Not a Walk in the Park! Challenges of Idiom Translation in Speech-to-text Systems
Attention on Multiword Expressions: A Multilingual Study of BERT-based Models with Regard to Idiomaticity and Microsyntax
The Effect of Word Predictability on Spoken Cross-Language Intelligibility
publications.authors: Wei Xue, Iuliia Zaitova, Bernd Moebius

publications.title: Cross-Linguistic Intelligibility of Non-Compositional Expressions in Spoken Context
Cross-Linguistic Processing of Non-Compositional Expressions in Slavic Languages
Microsyntactic Unit Detection using Word Embedding Models: Experiments on Slavic Languages

awards: Small Grant Scheme for Doctoral Researchers of the MGK - CRC 1102
professional_development: UMLV 2023: Summer School on Linguistic Variability
RANLP 2023: Summer School on Deep Learning in NLP

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
